title: Salman Rushdie could confront man charged with stabbing him when trial begins
description: Author Salman Rushdie could take the stand against the man accused of repeatedly stabbing him when the defendant goes on trial early next year

title: WATCH:  Father of Israeli child hostages speaks out
description: Avihai Brodutch’s wife and three children were abducted during the Hamas attack three weeks ago.

title: WATCH:  Father of Israeli-American child hostages speaks out
description: Avihai Brodutch’s wife and three children were abducted during the Hamas attack three weeks ago.

title: Georgia's Fort Gordon becomes last of 9 US Army posts to be renamed
description: The U.S. Army's Fort Gordon officially became Fort Eisenhower on Friday during a renaming ceremony in Augusta, Georgia.

title: 3 teens shot outside a west Baltimore high school as students were arriving
description: Three teenagers were wounded in a shooting outside a west Baltimore high school around the time classes were starting Friday morning

title: US troops targeted again in Iraq after retribution airstrikes
description: Attacks on American troops in Middle East continue.

title: Robert E. Lee statue that prompted deadly protest in Virginia melted down
description: A statue of Confederate Gen. Robert E

title: Rep. George Santos pleads not guilty to fraud charges, trial set for September 2024
description: Santos pleaded not guilty Friday to the charges contained in a superseding indictment.

title: Coast Guard ends search for 3 Georgia fishermen missing at sea for nearly 2 weeks
description: The U.S. Coast Guard has ended its search for three fishermen who are missing at sea nearly two weeks after their boat left the docks in Georgia

title: Cruise, GM's robotaxi service, suspends all driverless operations nationwide
description: General Motors’ Cruise says it's suspending its driverless operations nationwide as the robotaxi service works to rebuild public trust

title: Rep. George Santos pleads not guilty to fraud charges, trial set for September 2024
description: Trial was set for Sept. 9, 2024 and is expected to last three weeks.

title: Federal Reserve preferred inflation gauge shows persistent underlying price pressures
description: An inflation gauge that is closely monitored by the Federal Reserve showed price increases remained elevated in September amid brisk consumer spending and strong economic growth

title: Democratic Rep. Dean Phillips launches 2024 White House bid in challenge to Biden
description: The three-term congressman will compete in the New Hampshire primary.

title: Biden administration encouraging conversion of empty offices to affordable housing
description: The Biden administration is launching a multi-agency effort to encourage states and cities to convert more empty office buildings into housing units, with billions of federal dollars available to help spur such transitions

title: China's chief epidemiologist who helped drive the anti-COVID fight dies at age 60
description: China's chief epidemiologist, who helped drive anti-COVID-19 measures that suspended access to cities and confined millions to their homes, has died

title: US expands its effort to cut off funding for Hamas
description: The United States on Friday expanded its effort to cut off funding for Hamas, announcing a second round of sanctions against people and organizations linked to the group since it launched an attack on Israel that killed more than 1,400 people

title: Twitter takeover: 1 year later, X struggles with misinformation, usage decline
description: One year ago, Elon Musk walked into Twitter’s HQ with a white bathroom sink.

title: Her 6-year-old son shot his teacher. Now she is being sentenced for child neglect
description: The mother of a 6-year-old who shot his teacher in Virginia is scheduled to be sentenced for felony child neglect

title: US military says Chinese fighter jet came within 10 feet of B-52 bomber
description: A Chinese fighter jet came within 10 feet of an American B-52 bomber flying over the South China Sea, nearly causing an accident, the U.S. military says, underscoring the potential for a mishap as both countries vie for influence in the region

title: South Korean and US forces stage drills for 'Hamas-style' attack by North Korea
description: South Korean and U.S. troops have been conducting live-fire exercises to hone their ability to respond to potential “Hamas-style surprise artillery attacks” by North Korea

title: Abortion restrictions in Russia spark outrage as country takes conservative turn
description: Recent proposals by authorities to restrict access to abortion have touched a nerve across Russia, which has embraced increasingly conservative values

title: Israel-Gaza live updates: US making progress toward escape for Americans in Gaza
description: Live updates on the Israel-Gaza conflict.

title: Africa’s fashion industry is growing to meet global demands: UNESCO
description: A UNESCO report released during Lagos Fashion Week notes Africa’s fashion industry is growing rapidly to meet demand but that inadequate investment still limits its potential

title: US strikes back at Iranian-backed groups who attacked troops in Iraq, Syria: Pentagon
description: U.S. aircraft carried out strikes in Syria against facilities associated with Iranian-backed groups believed to be responsible for attacks on troops, the military said.

title: State Department struggles to explain why American citizens still can't exit Gaza
description: While the State Department publicly faults Hamas for Americans' inability to leave, privately, officials say it's more complicated.

title: Maine Rep. Jared Golden says mass shooting changed his mind on assault weapons ban
description: Rep. Jared Golden, who lives in Lewiston, Maine, said that in light of the recent mass shooting in his town he was changing his view on banning assault-style weapons
